alert.note: Alert for Kittson; West Marshall; West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 13 at 2:58AM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. South winds will gust up to 35 mph from late morning through the afternoon. There may be an hour or two of a lull in the late afternoon, before winds turn northwest and gust up to 35 mph again. Falling and blowing snow will result in visibilities below a half mile in open country. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills, as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of the central and northern Red River Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of falling and blowing snow will significantly reduce the visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
